author: A_Brickset_user
title: The Best Of The New MINIs
review:
I bought this and i liked it a lot:

PLUS
*It looks like the what its supposed to be, not many other MINIs can manage that
*Some class pieces

MINUS
*the radar doesnt turn all the way round, qand, is woobly
*the cockpit could at least be a diifferent colour

OVERALL
The bbest of the newset MINIS.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Sweet now I can make the falcon do flips!
review: Finelly I can make the Falcon do flips and tricks, cause the Larger Falcon is to delacate to do flipps. really cool this set is, i like the detailed prints on the top piece, but why couldnt Lego have put a print of the cockpit inseatd of just a grey piece. all in all i think this set was really well done. (but the piture of this set in Lego magazine was backwards, the cockpit and the satilit dish were on the wrong sides.)

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great model
review:
This mini is great, it's fun to build and displays well along side my other SW's.

The only complaint I have is with the manual, one set calls for you to attach a 3x3 angled to the underside of the model but given the angle the picture is on, attaching the piece correctly took many attempts.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great but not minifig capable...Easy to build though
review: I love this set! Its detailed for its size but its not minifig capable and the cockpit is not detailed. If ya dont like dis set I bash ya teeth out!!! whats that? you dont!!?? well thats your problem buddy!! WACK!!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: "What a hunk of Junk"- luke
review:
I don't reflect this set as my review summary puts it. I've quoted it incase others think I hate it. This set is great but compared to the big millennium falcon it justs lack that bit of cockpit and  birds eye detail. 
Pluses:
* Cool little mini
* Easy to play with 
Minuses:
* Cockpit should have a different colour and top should have a tad more detail
Overall another great mini by lego

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Best Mini Model!
review: The Falcon? It is a great ship, and unlike the regular model you can play with it with ease! It is a very similar model to the mvies and captures most of the big details!  It is larger than the palm of your hand, but you can really play with it, which I am thankful for!!!

author: tauntaunwampa
title: A collection without this is a breeze
review:
this has to be hands down the best mini model ever the detail is fantastic and lookes awsome. This spacecraft is a pro at dogfights and easy to build the only problem is that the solar dish always comes off.

PROS
great detail
good for dogfights 
awsome back lights
CONS
solar dish comes off easyly

this is a must have for all lego star wars collectors

author: Gus_263
title: Another good builted mini sized replica
review: This mini version of the Millennium falcon is another of the mini replicas of the Star Wars theme, and like some other, still cool due to the building. As a mini set, this millennium falcon of course don't includes a minifigure. Altough is just another mini set, this is too good builted in comparison with the size, and still recognizable. The building consists in some encurved or triangular small plates conneceted by some other pieces and above these is a circular big piece, used as the top of the millennium falcon, with some printed designs to looks like more it. The piece used in the place of the cockpit have a correct shape but the design don't looks like more it, altough have also the correct colors. The color scheme is good, but not much detailed. As a mini set, the playability is limited, but the set includes useful pieces. Overall, a good mini sized set.

author: Yoda____
title: Fastest ship in the galaxy
review: When i got this I was very surprised that a set would have special printed bricks which to my knowledge aren't in any other sets. I liked the build and found it mor fun to build than the gunship. Overall it turned out well too. The way the cockpit has been added on seems clever and this is overall a good set.

author: Kalhiki
title: Brilliant!
review:
Very good for a mini set. It's simpicity actually adds to the accuracy and uniquness (does that make sense?). It's painted top adds the main detail of the model. It also has the dish which is in scale to the rest of the model. The cockpit could at least have a sticker to make it more accurate or a painted surface. The engines are also flat instead of rouned around the back. It also includes the escape pods on either side.
Overall, a good set. It's better than othe minis, but I still give it a 4/5. Definately get it if you're going to get a mini set.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Star Wars - Millennium Falcon Review
review:
This set is part of the second wave of the mini Star Wars collection. This time LEGO decided to produce only one mini model in one set. But we still get some extra pieces to build another mini Star Wars vehicle. If you've collected all 4 sets of this wave (sets 4488, 4489, 4490 & 4491) you can build a mini y-wing. This set is a fun build and it's very useful if you want to use the pieces for MOC's (My own creations) and brickfilms. This set also comes with some rare pieces which makes it valuable as well. It's a good set to have and I can't complain much about it. We also don't get any stickers to worry about.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion 1
Stopmotion 2
Review

author: AETerry
title: Mini Millennium Falcon Review
review:
The mini sets for Star Wars that LEGO has done have been some of the best and funnest, even when a particular set isn't ultimately my favorite.

 

With this mini set of the Millennium Falcon, you have one of the cheapest and best ways to get a Lego model of this ship. The build is solid and I found that even after a move and having tossed this into storage, the ship still held together very well with few pieces needing to be put back on.

 

It's great attention to detail for a Lego model on a mini scale and they're just great to build, set around for disply and affordable prices.

author: Optimus_Wombat
title: Another hit!
review:
Up front, I'd like to say that I love the LEGO Star Wars mini models.  They're easy to build, solid, and a decent value.  Whether you're a child or just a child-at-heart, they're great for flying around the living room without worrying about a chunk falling off.

The Millennium Falcon mini is all those things I mentioned, and more.  It's detailed enough to be instantly recognisable as the Falcon, but it's not over-engineered with little bits and pieces that impair the structural integrity of the model.  In fact, the top and bottom pieces are each _single_ round moulded plates, just attach them to the rest of the body and you're good to go!  These plates also come pre-printed, so no silly little stickers to fuss with.

And to top it off, this model contains one of the four bonus sections to build a mini Y-Wing Fighter.

How good is that?

5/5 good.
